section_title: CARTAGENA DIALOGUE FOR PROGRESSIVE ACTION ON CLIMATE CHANGE:
sentences: The Cartagena Dialogue for Progressive Action on Climate Change met from 3-4 April 2012 in Nairobi, Kenya.
The meeting brought together over 80 representatives from 38 countries committed to progressive international collaborative action to address the climate change crisis.
UNFCCC Executive Secretary Christiana Figueres also attended the meeting.

Discussions on the Durban Platform focused on the need to build on the political momentum of COP 17, to think creatively about the governance and organization of work of the ADP, and strategies for delivering a new legally-binding agreement by 2015.

The Dialogue recognized the need to finalize details for the second commitment period under the Kyoto Protocol, enhance mitigation ambition in the period leading up to 2020, operationalize the institutions and mechanisms agreed at previous COPs and the critical role of adaptation and finance.
